item.title: [release] granite mace [from jagex] [updated ints]
item.dc:creator: @I_PK_Pigeons I PK Pigeons
item.description:
@I_PK_Pigeons wrote:

[quote=“ak226688, post:5, topic:277087”]i dint know da name but i no its from summot to with goblins =S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 04, 2009, 04:40:03 am[/size][hr][quote author=I PK Pigeons link=topic=365753.msg2774258#msg2774258 date=1241430657]

This is a granite mace.

But it looks good. I never heard of Goblin Mace though.

That’s because it’s called the Granite Mace
By the way, proper rotations etc

	case 1420:
		class8.aString170 = "Granite Mace";
		class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
		class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";
		class8.aStringArray189[4] = "Drop";
		class8.anInt174 = ####;
		class8.anInt181 = 1888;
		class8.anInt190 = 1632;
		class8.anInt198 = 1632;
		class8.anInt194 = 4;
		class8.anInt169 = -7;
		class8.anInt204 = 0;
		class8.anInt165 = ###;
		class8.anInt200 = ###;
		class8.anInt188 = -1;
		class8.aByteArray178 = "A mace made out of granite.".getBytes();
	break;

Then it looks correct

[/quote]how do u add that?[/quote]

Add what? The mace?
I already had it, but I just gave you the proper rotations for the item

Read full topic

This is a granite mace.
[/quote]
But it looks good. I never heard of Goblin Mace though.[/quote]

That’s because it’s called the Granite Mace
By the way, proper rotations etc

	case 1420:
		class8.aString170 = "Granite Mace";
		class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
		class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";
		class8.aStringArray189[4] = "Drop";
		class8.anInt174 = ####;
		class8.anInt181 = 1888;
		class8.anInt190 = 1632;
		class8.anInt198 = 1632;
		class8.anInt194 = 4;
		class8.anInt169 = -7;
		class8.anInt204 = 0;
		class8.anInt165 = ###;
		class8.anInt200 = ###;
		class8.anInt188 = -1;
		class8.aByteArray178 = "A mace made out of granite.".getBytes();
	break;

Then it looks correct

item.title: [release] granite mace [from jagex] [updated ints]
item.dc:creator: @ak226688 ak226688
item.description:
@ak226688 wrote:

                                                             |100% to jagex|
                                                             |--------------|


gobmace.jpg647×511

i dunno if has alredy been released if it has sorry for posting it
here are ints:if(i == #####) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = #####; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt165 = #####; // Male Wield Model class8.anInt200 = #####; // Female Wield class8.anInt188 = #####; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = #####; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 1888; class8.anInt190 = 1632; class8.anInt198 = 1799; class8.anInt194 = 23; class8.anInt169 = -7; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aString170 = "granite mace"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "A mace made out of granite.".getBytes(); }
its animated and fitted if theres any problems pm me

W is weild D is drop and the granite_mace.rar is both in 1 folder

to add open up class8.java c+p the ints into it underneth another pair of ints ( under this “}” )
then dl the models then rename them to wat ever model ids u want and put in your clients model folder.
then change it in the ints save compile run then wen ur logged in type:
“add model [wat u put for weild]”
“add model [wat u put for drop]”

not: “::add model ####”
u dont need these : “[ ]”

not :
